intro: Synaphea trinacriformis, commonly known as the three-lobed synaphea, is a rare and distinctive member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often described as having a trilobed appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
